text: :smiling_face_with_heart-eyes::smiling_face_with_heart-eyes::face_savoring_food::face_savoring_food::brown_heart::brown_heart::hot_beverage::hot_beverage::white_heart::white_heart::star-struck::star-struck:
postCaption: Iced Cinnamon Dolce Latte I knew not to froth my cold foam in the tiny espresso shot glass anyways! What I used - 2 starbucks blonde espresso pods - 1 - 2 tsps of Cinnamon Dolce syrup (Jordan’s skinny syrups) - creamer - heavy whipping cream - ice Cold Foam: - 1/3 cup of heavy cream - 1-2 tbsp creamer or milk - 1/2 tsp cinnamon dolce syrup Recipe 1. Brew your espresso shots and add both your syrup and espresso to your drinking glass. Mix together well. 2. Next, add your ice and then milk (or creamer) to your coffee. Add your milk/creamer if preferred. 3. Froth your heavy cream, creamer or milk, and syrup until you have a thick consistency. 4. Add frothed milk to your drinking glass and enjoy! • • • • • • • • • • • • • • • #thecoffeegirly #pinterest #pinterestinspired #coffee #coffeelover #coffeeaddict #coffeegram #coffeebar #nespressovertuo #icedcoffee #icedcoffeelovers #morning #morningroutine #morningcoffee #vlog #dailyvlog #icedcoffeelovers #nespresso #vertuonext #icedcoffeerecipes #coffeeaesthetic

text: Practical and good coffee, I'm sorry they don't make ecocapsules and over time I noticed a bad smell from where it dispenses water. I'll try a way to disinfect the part but in my opinion it's a material that retains humidity.
postCaption: Lavazza A Modo Mio Tiny is the best way to start your day! In its small size, Tiny is a great Lavazza A Modo Mio coffee machine.
negativeTopicClass: Capsules and Compatibility, Maintenance and Durability

text: the machine would also be fine but these luminaries.... they made a waste water container pity.!!!! every time you make coffee a little water is thrown away,. in the old ones it went into a container below and after 15 20 coffees it was thrown away. this one instead already after the third coffee comes out. but I say how much the fuck did it take to make the bigger container.???? BIG FAILURE

text: By now the word eco-sustainable is a joke. Use capsules. The moka is the only sustainable one. And the compostable capsules inside the composter when after 1 year they were basically healthy but dirty with compost were still whole. We make a better impression by not using inappropriate terms like compostable and eco-sustainable.:grinning_face_with_sweat::face_with_tears_of_joy:

text: If you want to start a coffee over 80 ml, start watching "Lord of the Rings", maybe your coffee will be ready before the King returns... More seriously, “a modo mio” is typically made for the taste of Italian coffee (between 35 and 50 ml volume); There are many machines for brewing larger cups on the market, mainly those with built-in grinders. I have one of each in my kitchen, for totally different coffees...

text: Hello, I am Italian. You have dispensed an enormous amount of coffee. The taste of one of those small pods can be better enjoyed in a much smaller quantity, like a short espresso, which equals 1/3 of a small coffee cup. Approximately 50 milliliters or 50 grams. Greetings from Italy :)

text: Excellent product, excellent quality/price ratio

Excellent coffee, small tank, excessively small tray I have the previous model that I use in another house and, since the old tiny one is no longer in production, I decided to buy this one. The positive side is that it makes excellent coffee and takes very little time to heat up. Noisier than the previous one, it also has a couple of other slightly unpleasant defects: the water tank is very small and must be filled continuously and the water collection tray is really tiny and, even if emptied every 3 or 4 dispensings, it fills up and lets the water overflow onto the shelf on which the machine is placed. All in all I would buy it again but it was a step backwards compared to the previous model.
